name: Artemis
title: Greek - Artemis
subtitle: Goddess of the Hunt, Wilderness, and the Moon
shortDescription: Virgin goddess of the hunt, wild animals, and the moon. Twin sister of Apollo , Artemis roams the wilderness with her band of nymphs, protecting young creatures and punishing those who offend her.
longDescription:
Artemis 's myths emphasize her independence, her protection of the natural world, and her fierce punishment of those who violate her sanctity or harm her companions.

Artemis 's most famous temple was at Ephesus (one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World). Major cult sites also existed at Brauron in Attica, Sparta (as Artemis Orthia), and throughout wilderness areas. Her shrines were often in forests, on mountains, or near springs.

Hunters offered Artemis the first fruits of the hunt. Young girls dedicated their toys and childhood garments to her before marriage. Pregnant women and new mothers made offerings seeking her protection during childbirth. Goats and deer were sacrificed, and her altars received cakes shaped like animals.

Artemis was invoked for successful hunts, safe childbirth, protection of young children (especially girls), and preservation of chastity. Hunters and travelers in wild places sought her guidance and protection. Women in childbirth called upon her despite her virginity, as she had helped birth her brother Apollo .

attributes.domains: the Hunt, Wilderness, and the Moon

siblings: Numerous children of Zeus including Athena

worship.sacredSites: Artemis 's most famous temple was at Ephesus (one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World). Major cult sites also existed at Brauron in Attica, Sparta (as Artemis Orthia), and throughout wilderness areas. Her shrines were often in forests, on mountains, or near springs.

festivals.name: Brauronia
festivals.description: Every four years at Brauron, young Athenian girls performed "bear dances" in saffron robes, honoring Artemis and marking transitions in girlhood.

festivals.name: Artemisia
festivals.description: Celebrated in various locations, honoring Artemis with processions and games.

relatedConcepts.name: üèπ HUNTRESS / MOON GODDESS
relatedConcepts.description: Artemis embodies the Huntress archetype - virgin goddess of wilderness, protector of the wild, and lunar deity who guards women and children.
